alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Plumas, northeastern Tehama, northeastern Butte, southeastern Shasta and Lassen Counties through 300 PM PDT... At 158 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lassen National Park to near Tobin. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mineral, Chester, Shingletown, Prattville, Storrie, Crescent Mills, Lake Almanor, Caribou, Lassen National Park, Twain, Canyondam, East Shore, Viola, Indian Falls, Tobin, Lake Almanor Country Club, Manzanita Lake, Seneca, Belden and Lake Almanor Peninsula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
